page.title: 15Churches
page.content: In 1985 one minister works 6 parishes- Kilmany,Flisk,Creich,Moonzie,Logie and Monimail.In 1762 Rathillet broke from Kilmany and started a church of their own.Their church was built in 1857 however they rejoined with Kilmany in 1930.Later in 1960 it closed down but was used as a tattie shed. In the 1960's Rathillet church was demolished to make way for the Tay Bridge road.Kilmany and Flisk united in 1957, while Creich and Moonzie united in 1947.A Christmas eve and a Rembrance Service are held in Moonzie each year. All four plus Logie united in 1972 and in 1983 Monimail linked up with them. From the 15th century Kilmany church was involved with St Andrews University.Thomas Chalmers,a student there,became minister at Kilmany (1803-15)and became famous as 1st principal of New Colledge,Edinburgh.
